title: Alpha question
body: is pbe and alpha the same?

replies.body:
No
PBE is an environment where people can test patches and help locate bugs and comment on balancing for balancing changes that are being implemented that patch, basically new content about to be released goes through there to be tested before it hits live servers.

the Alpha client is the new client/game interface that Riot is in the process of developing, changing the layout and look. If I remember correctly it will no longer be done with Adobe Air and will be coded using html5 that will give it a broader range of what it can do to interact with Riot servers as well as supposed improved functionality. In short coding a whole new game client from the ground up to replace the current one, so they have some people testing that as well to test for bugs and errors to fix before releasing it.

pbe and alpha client are, however, not the same thing.

The information Wolfess provided is solid.  The Alpha client uses your live account, so anything that happens there would also be reflected if you returned to the live client.  The PBE is a seperate campaign that's used to help test out other new content and not specifically the alpha.  Hope that helps clear things up!
